name: Krenshaw

topics.response_text: He watches over the city from Haven, his tower in Uptown. Take the northeast exit from here and look for the tallest building in town.

topics.topic_text: He just expects me to jump to attention?
topics.response_text: No, he expects you to accept his courteous invitation. Or at least to guess what would happen if you keep him waiting.{Euphemisms barely covering threats}
Well now, aren't you quite the scrapper? Congratulations.

conversation.response_text: I'm telling you, they're planning something!{In the middle of a heated debate, pounding on the table on "planning"}
And I suppose you'll follow that up by raising the dead?{Irritated mockery of Ashur's confidence}
Sir, we've had sightings of Wernher back in the city, and there's been an increase in chatter between slaves.{Frustrated, and tired of joking. Pounding on the desk at "Sir"}
Whatever we call them, they've been gathering makeshift weapons.{Irritated and dismissive of the correction}
Yes, sir!{As a soldier receiving orders. Saluting smartly.}

description:
Krenshaw is a 39 year-old Caucasian Male.

Krenshaw serves as Ashur's second-in-command in the industrial settlement known as the Pitt. A loyal and pragmatic raider, he oversees daily operations and security concerns, maintaining order in the dangerous Uptown district. Krenshaw is known for his cautious approach to potential threats, particularly from the enslaved population working in the mills below.

Krenshaw's Personality: Krenshaw is pragmatic, security-focused, and somewhat impatient with what he perceives as Ashur's leniency. He values order and control above all else, showing particular concern about potential slave revolts. Despite his frustrations, he remains loyal to Ashur and carries out his duties with precision and efficiency.

Krenshaw's Backstory: Born and raised in the harsh environment of the Pitt, Krenshaw rose through the ranks of the raiders through displays of loyalty and tactical competence. He witnessed the settlement's transformation under Ashur's leadership and proved himself as a reliable enforcer. When Wernher betrayed the settlement and fled, Krenshaw was naturally selected to fill the power vacuum as Ashur's right-hand man, a position he has held with increasing influence over the years.
